hypothesis_content.title: Stress Regime VIX-of-Crypto (BTC DVOL) Spike Reversion
hypothesis_content.statement: During STRESS regimes, when the Deribit BTC DVOL Index (30-day implied volatility) spikes to levels above the 95th percentile of its 90-day range, it will revert by at least 15% within the next 5 trading days, predicting a calming of volatility and a potential bounce in spot BTC.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extreme fear, measured by implied volatility spikes, is often a climax event in stress periods. Volatility is mean-reverting by nature. A reversion in DVOL typically coincides with exhaustion of panic selling and a short-term stabilization or bounce in price, as options dealers adjust hedges.
entry_conditions: Deribit BTC DVOL Index > 95th percentile of its 90-day rolling range
DVOL has increased by more than 25% over the prior 3 days
Entry: Long BTC spot or futures on next daily open

exit_conditions.take_profit: DVOL declines by 15% from entry level OR BTC spot price increases by 8% from entry
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC spot price decreases by an additional 5% from entry

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If the correlation between a 15%+ DVOL decline and a positive BTC return over the following 5 days is less than +0.3 in stress periods.
